responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: "Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in default.html via Unsanitized User-generated Content"
    analysis: |
      The template file default.html directly injects dynamic content via the `{{ content }}` handle which lacks any explicit sanitization or encoding. Given the pattern, any user-generated content rendered through this template could potentially include malicious scripts, which are then executed in the context of the user's session when rendered by their browser. This flaw is a focal point for XSS attacks, creating a vulnerability where attackers could steal session cookies, execute actions in the context of users, and potentially take over accounts.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - "docs/_layouts/default.html"
    classification: "very promising"
  - headline: "Potential Server-Side Template Injection via Improper Neutralization"
    analysis: |
      Various files in the 'docs' directory, such as head.html and default.html, utilize server-side template inclusion mechanisms with improperly neutralized inputs (e.g., '{{ site.title }}', '{{ site.description }}'). If an attacker gains control over these 'site' parameters, they could potentially inject arbitrary template directives or code leading to unauthorized server actions or data exposure. This behavior heightens risks of SSRF or local file inclusion due to the server processing untrusted template inputs.
    cwe: CWE-94
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - "docs/_layouts/default.html"
      - "docs/_includes/head.html"
    classification: "very promising"
```

leads.headline: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in default.html via Unsanitized User-generated Content
leads.analysis: The template file default.html directly injects dynamic content via the {{ content }} handle which lacks any explicit sanitization or encoding. Given the pattern, any user-generated content rendered through this template could potentially include malicious scripts, which are then executed in the context of the user's session when rendered by their browser. This flaw is a focal point for XSS attacks, creating a vulnerability where attackers could steal session cookies, execute actions in the context of users, and potentially take over accounts.

leads.headline: Potential Server-Side Template Injection via Improper Neutralization
leads.analysis: Various files in the 'docs' directory, such as head.html and default.html, utilize server-side template inclusion mechanisms with improperly neutralized inputs (e.g., '{{ site.title }}', '{{ site.description }}'). If an attacker gains control over these 'site' parameters, they could potentially inject arbitrary template directives or code leading to unauthorized server actions or data exposure. This behavior heightens risks of SSRF or local file inclusion due to the server processing untrusted template inputs.
